newsitem.title: USA: New Mexico 187 MW coal-fired unit back on line.
newsitem.headline: New Mexico 187 MW coal-fired unit back on line.

text.p: The 187 megawatt (MW) unit 2 at the Four Corners coal-fired power plant in New Mexico was restarted Saturday after being shut Wednesday because of a tube leak, sources familiar with the unit said Tuesday.
Four Corners' units 4 and 5, each at 750 MW, as well as the 186 MW unit 1 and 244 MW unit 3 were also said to be operating normally.
Arizona Public Service, which operates Four Corners, owns units 1, 2, and 3 along with 15 percent of units 4 and 5.
Southern California Edison Co holds a 48 percent stake in units 4 and 5.
